alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 1:46PM PST until January 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Snow accumulations 2 to 4 inches west of US-395, little accumulation east of US-395, 6 to 12 inches along the Sierra crest. Winds gusting up to 40 to 60 mph in lower communities and over 100 mph along the Sierra crest. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...Until 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Roads, especially over higher passes along Highway 395, will likely become slick and hazardous. Plan on slippery road conditions. Very strong winds could cause extensive damage to trees and power lines and be very hazardous for high profile vehicles.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
